item.title: Bridge returned error 400! (18901)
item.content:encoded:
Twitter @homelessoutloud was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `The requested resource cannot be found!
Please make sure your input parameters are correct!
cUrl error: (0)
PHP error: `
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Twitter&context=By+username&u=homelessoutloud&norep=on&nopic=on&noimg=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

item.title: Joshua had all of his personal belongings trashed this morning...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Joshua had all of his personal belongings trashed this morning before he could get back to his tent at 7:30. Based on the posting from the city regarding the sweep today, he was under the impression he had til 8:00 am and would be offered storage.
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: "publicized conditions at encampments have drawn...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"publicized conditions at encampments have drawn discontent... they also distract from a critical conversation around fundamental human needs. Thousands of our neighbors are unhoused. Someone needs to help them access the resources that will help them survive."

https://coloradosun.com/…/homeless-water-restrooms-parks-o…/

Only a portion of public restrooms and water fountains in parks are in working order

coloradosun.com

Opinion: Access to water is a human right, unless you’re unhoused in Denver

Only a portion of public restrooms and water fountains in parks are in working orderOnly a portion of public restrooms and water fountains in parks are in working order
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: The day after accepting the Newsed Civil Rights Award community...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

The day after accepting the Newsed Civil Rights Award community leaders Paul, Irish and Audrey get swept from their encampment.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A2vDjcSsQhI

The day after accepting the Newsed Civil Rights Award community leaders Paul, Irish and Audrey get swept from their encampment.

youtube.com

item.title: SWEEPS week of 9/27-10/1/21 SWEEPS next week are on Tuesday 9/28...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

SWEEPS week of 9/27-10/1/21
SWEEPS next week are on Tuesday 9/28 at W. Bayaud Avenue to the North, S. Cherokee Street to the East, W. Alameda Avenue to the South, and Santa Fe Drive to the West.; on Wednesday 9/29 at E. 19th Avenue to the North, Logan Street to the East, E. 17th Avenue to the South, and Lincoln Street to the West; and on Thursday 9/30 at E. 10th Avenue to the North, Pennsylvania Street to the East, E. 8th Avenue to the South, and Sherman Street to the West.
T...he SWEEPS will begin each day at 5 a.m.
Please bring the following things to assist residents:

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move
-Carts
-Bungee Cords
-Rope
-Trash Bags
-Food
-Coffee/Cocoa
-Water
Please come and support our unhoused community members as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.
Your advocacy is much appreciated!
Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

See More
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: SWEEPS update week of 9/20/20-9/24/21 SWEEPS this week began on...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

SWEEPS update week of 9/20/20-9/24/21
SWEEPS this week began on Tuesday 9/21/21 at 22nd and Washington St. It was a cold morning, it had just finished raining. Approximately 16 people were traumatically displaced.

SWEEPS continued on Wednesday 9/22/21 ar Arkins (AGAIN). The fencing covered several blocks and there were a number of traffic jams/ trucks unable to pass. Approximately 45 people were traumatically displaced.
SWEEPS concluded on Thursday 9/23/21 at 16th and Downin...g right outside of the DHOL office. This was hands down the cleanest camp in town. There was very little for EHS to do (other than trash the belongings that residents were forced to leave). Despite it being immaculate, EHS dumped an entire truck of bleach water down the street and into the storm drains. Approximately 8 people were traumatically displaced. DHOL was able to get 3 motel rooms for 4 nights for some of the residents.
SWEEPING people does not work. Homelesness is only solved by HOUSING. Until we have the housing for people to move into, we must stop this nonsensical and expensive whack-a-mole non solution. We march onward towards Rights, Dignity, Housing....

item.title: "Last year was the first time in the history of the...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"Last year was the first time in the history of the official U.S. homeless count that we found more unsheltered homeless individuals than sheltered"

And the eviction moratorium just ended... what do you think is going to happen next?

https://www.thesunmagazine.org/issues/550/displaced

To insist that people who have a mobile shelter are “homeless” not only denies that their shelter can be a home; it also has the potential to deny t

thesunmagazine.org

The Sun Magazine | Displaced | Thacher Schmid | Issue 550

To insist that people who have a mobile shelter are “homeless” not only denies that their shelter can be a home; it also has the potential to deny tTo insist that people who have a mobile shelter are “homeless” not only denies that their shelter can be a home; it also has the potential to deny t
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: Some phots from last nights Civil Rights Awards Banquet ... ...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Some phots from last nights Civil Rights Awards Banquet ... Have some video coming out soon of the statements made. And of the sweep of these folks who will be swept tomorrow morning. Imagine doing a public speaking event and then having to negotiate getting swept the next morning.

item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: The victims of that "increase in crime" he describes...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

The victims of that "increase in crime" he describes are those in the encampments. His reason for making that statement and leaving that information out is to help "manufacture consent" from the housed community so they can send their sanctioned vigilante mobs out to hassle the encampments.

Remember the eviction moratorium just passed. There are so many more people coming to the streets. Ticketing them for being poor will not help us.

https://kdvr.com/…/denver-to-launch-civilian-camping-ban-e…/

In less than a month, Denver expects to deploy a team of civilians to enforce the city’s camping ban.

kdvr.com

Denver to launch civilian camping ban enforcement team

In less than a month, Denver expects to deploy a team of civilians to enforce the city’s camping ban.In less than a month, Denver expects to deploy a team of civilians to enforce the city’s camping ban.
